flawed_nl_solution:
Luke started putting together, 1000 x 0.1 = <<1000*0.1=100>>100 pieces.
The next day, there were 1000-100 = <<1000-100=900>>900 pieces left.
Then he put together 900 * 0.2 = <<900*0.2=180>>180 pieces on the second day.
So there were 900 - 180 = <<900-180=720>>720 pieces left.
On the third day, he put together 720 * 0.3 = <<720*0.3=216>>216 pieces.
Therefore, Luke still has 720 - 216 = <<720-216=499>>499 pieces left to complete the puzzle.
#### 499

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 504, not 499. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
